meanings.sent1: The story she told was verry true.
meanings.sent2: The sky looked verry blue today.
meanings.sent3: He wore a verry serious expression to the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as verry as a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The verry fact that he was late again annoyed me.

meanings.definition: To a high degree or extent
meanings.sent1: She verry quickly finished her homework.
meanings.sent2: The flowers verry beautifully bloomed in the garden.
meanings.sent3: He verry enthusiastically cheered for his team.
meanings.sent4: The news spread verry rapidly throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The music played verry loudly at the concert.
